name: Garza
descriptions: Garza is a citizen of Rivet City and general laborer for Doctor Madison Li's science team in Fallout 3.

Born around 2247, Garza is a physically imposing and very reserved man. His past is a mystery to others in Rivet City, and he refuses to talk about it with anyone. In fact, he would prefer not to talk at all, and tends to limit his speech to as few words as necessary.
Garza claims to have had little purpose in his life before Doctor Madison Li helped him through a difficult time in his life.
Garza spends his free time working out on the Rivet City flight deck.

The following is Garza's intended daily schedule in Rivet City. His home room is on the ground floor of the Rivet City science lab, and he will try to stay there at any time that he does not have other activities in his schedule.
Garza is the Spanish word for heron.

topics.response_text: I am sorry. I cannot continue. I need to rest for a while.{firm, defiant}

topics.topic_text: What do you do around here?
topics.response_text: I help Doctor Li when she needs equipment moved. I am no scientist, I just help with the heavy things.

topics.topic_text: Really? You sure don't look like a scientist.
topics.response_text: No, no. I am only here to help with moving things, lifting heavy equipment. I am no scientist.
I am Garza. I help Doctor Li here in the lab.

topics.topic: MQ05GarzaICanHelpWe need to do something about Garza.
topics.topic_text: Hey. Is there anything I can do to help?
topics.response_text: I do not have my usual supplies of medicine. I was too hasty in leaving.

topics.topic: MQ05GarzaMedsHere, take some Stimpaks. That should get him through.
topics.response_text: Ah, so you do. Give them to Doctor Li, if you please.

topics.topic_text: Sorry, I guess there isn't anything I can do right now.
topics.response_text: Perhaps if I just rest a while... [gasp] Perhaps not.

topics.topic_text: You're only going to slow us down. Maybe you should stay behind.
topics.response_text: Yes, you are right. There is no reason to put everyone at risk on my account. Go on without me.

topics.topic_text: Let's go. This is no time to sit down.
topics.response_text: I'm afraid I can't do that.

topics.topic_text: What's the matter? Are you all right?
topics.response_text: I... my heart. It's weak, and I have no medicine with me.

topics.topic_text: Do you think Project Purity will ever work again?
topics.response_text: If Doctor Li says it will work, then it will be so.

topics.topic_text: Anything I should know about this place?
topics.response_text: The Brotherhood of Steel was overwhelmed by mutants here. Be careful they do not overwhelm you; I am sure some still lurk within the tunnels.

topics.topic_text: Can you help get us through this?
topics.response_text: I am feeling better, but not well enough to be of use to you. I apologize.{pained, winded}
I have worked for Doctor Li for many years. She has been good to me, helped me through some difficult times.

topics.topic: MS03RCHistory1Could I ask you about Rivet City's history?
topics.topic_text: Can I ask you about Rivet City's history?

topics.response_text: No, no. Perhaps if I had more time to rest.{winded, in pain}

conversation.response_text: I am sorry to be causing problems.
Doctor Li. My heart... I must rest.
I cannot make it on my own, Doctor Li! I am too weak!{sickly, terrified}
Thank you, Doctor Li. I'm feeling better already. Let us continue, and not waste more time here.
I insist. You have greater problems to worry about. I will be all right. Now please, go.
I'm going top side for a while.
The doctor is fine. If it weren't for her work, Rivet City would be no better than Megaton, Danvers.
